## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**AI Assistant:**
Hey there! I'm here to help with any Verus-related issues you might be experiencing. What's going on with your wallet?

**User:**
My wallet is stuck on a specific block number and no longer synchronizes properly. What should I do?

**AI Assistant:**
Don't worry, I'm here to help! If your wallet is stuck, first check if your wallet's block height is significantly lower than the current block height on the Verus explorer (more than 10 blocks behind). If it is, follow this procedure: close your wallet, add nodes to your `VRSC.conf` file, save and exit, remove the `peers.dat` file, and then restart your wallet. If the problem persists, refer to the Verus wiki for further troubleshooting. Have you tried that already?

**User:**
No, I haven't tried that yet. But before I do, I'm not sure where to find my wallet files. Where are the standard locations for Verus wallet files on different operating systems?

**AI Assistant:**
The standard locations for Verus wallet files are:

* Linux: `~/.komodo/VRSC`
* Mac OS: `~/Library/Application Support/Komodo/VRSC`
* Windows 10: `%AppData%\Roaming\Komodo\VRSC\`
* OS independent through Verus Desktop: Click `help`, `Show Verus data folder (default)`

You should be able to find your files in one of those locations. Now, about those nodes... do you need help getting an updated list of working nodes for your wallet?

**User:**
Yeah, that would be great. How can I get an updated list of working nodes?

**AI Assistant:**
Easy one! You can get an updated list of working nodes by messaging `/peerinfo` in the #tipbot channel on the Verus Discord. You'll get a list of nodes that are currently working properly.

**User:**
Great, thanks for the help! Before I start troubleshooting, is there anything I should avoid doing?

**AI Assistant:**
When troubleshooting your Verus wallet, make sure not to remove any files or folders other than `peers.dat`, or you may need to bootstrap your wallet. That's a good rule of thumb to keep in mind. Now, go ahead and try the troubleshooting steps I mentioned earlier, and let me know if you need any further assistance!
What should I do if my Verus wallet is stuck on a specific block number and no longer synchronizes properly?

If your wallet is stuck, first check if your wallet's block height is significantly lower than the current block height on the Verus explorer (more than 10 blocks behind). If it is, follow the procedure outlined: close your wallet, add nodes to your `VRSC.conf` file, save and exit, remove the `peers.dat` file, and then restart your wallet. If the problem persists, refer to the Verus wiki for further troubleshooting.

# My wallet is stuck on block number XXXX. It does not synchronize properly anymore. note: Read it completely before use. ### Verus `Wallet.dat`, Chaindata & `VRSC.conf` standard locations * Linux:		`~/.komodo/VRSC` * Mac OS: 	`~/Library/Application Support/Komodo/VRSC` * Windows 10: 	`%AppData%\Roaming\Komodo\VRSC\` * OS independent through Verus Desktop: Click `help`, `Show Verus data folder (default)` #### Usefull links: Link 1: [Download latest Wallet](https://verus.io/wallet.html) Link 2: [Show current blockheight](https://explorer.verus.io/api/getblockcount) ## Procedure: In case your wallet is not synchronized with the blockchain and restarting doesn't connect to any peers: Compare your blockheight with the one Link 2 above is showing to make sure you are not synchronized anymore. If the blockheight of the link above is significantly higher (more than 10) than the blockheight your wallet is showing, follow the rest of the procedure. If the numbers are equal or close, your wallet is synchronized and the procedure below will not solve any problems. Close your wallet. Go to the appropriate location for your OS as mentioned above. Add a similar list to the bottom of your `VRSC.conf`, just below `rpcallowip=127.0.0.1`: ```  addnode=157.90.113.198:27485  addnode=95.217.1.76:27485 ``` Save and exit the file. An up-to-date list of working nodes can be found in Verus Discord in the #tipbot channel, by messaging `/peerinfo` in that channel. After you added nodes, remove `peers.dat` that is in the VRSC folder. (At least rename or move to a different location). Make sure you don't remove any other files/folders, or you'll have to [bootstrap](http://blacksquare/#!how-to/how-to_bootstrap.md) your wallet. Then start your wallet as you're used to. If the problem persists, continue with this WIKI: [Recover from forking, network or old wallet problems](https://wiki.verus.io/#!faq-allos/faq-allos19_what_should_i_do_if_i_end_up_on_my_own_fork_because_of_a_network_issue_or_having_an_old_version_of_the_wallet.md) Submitted by Oink.vrsc@ & Thoskk.vrsc@ Note: last revision date 2023-06-03.
Where can I find the standard locations for Verus wallet files on different operating systems?

The standard locations for Verus wallet files are:

* Linux: `~/.komodo/VRSC`
* Mac OS: `~/Library/Application Support/Komodo/VRSC`
* Windows 10: `%AppData%\Roaming\Komodo\VRSC\`
* OS independent through Verus Desktop: Click `help`, `Show Verus data folder (default)`

How can I get an updated list of working nodes for my Verus wallet?
You can get an updated list of working nodes by messaging `/peerinfo` in the #tipbot channel on the Verus Discord.
